page.title: 15 Footpaths & Bridleways.
page.content: The area has many footpaths & bridleways.Generally these are clearly- signposted,in good condition,& obviously well used,especialy near Kinver Edge & the village.Local farmers reported few problems where paths crossed farmland,although a few walkers found it difficult to follow a path when it crossed the middle of a field. Two County Council-maintained long distance paths meet in the area;the 95 mile Staffordshire Way & the 14 1/2 mile North Worcestershire Way,which join at Kingsforel Country Park(the county boundary).Regular path main- tenance,even step building has been nesacery on the heavily used section where the Staffs way climbs Kinver Edge Local legand says the broad,straight path which suddenly narrows near Herons Gate is a roman road which was abandon- ed when the Romans left Britan.
